title: HUGE lag spikes, never used to happen?
body: I recently started playing LoL about a month ago and I'm really enjoying it, however, a couple of days ago, the game crashed while I was in champion select and ever since then I've had major ping spikes, peaking at about 5000+ and steady at 400-600. My ping used to be around 30-90 and now LoL is simply unplayable for me and I have no idea why, please help! I use a macbook pro and my ISP is Optus.

replies.body: Yo, have you tried [changing your DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#mq3) yet?
I was considering doing so, but is it safe? Could it disrupt my internet connection or change anything on my computer?

Yes, it could, but Google's Public DNS has a really good reputation among the community, and most of the time it's better than the default DNS your ISP gives you.

Nevertheless, that's why you are told to remember your previous settings so that you can revert back if something goes wrong. It's safe to experiment with it, to see if it'll help you at all.

Hello, I have changed my DNS and I don't think it made that much of a difference, however, I think I realised that its mainly when other people are using wifi that my ping goes up. When no one else is using the wifi, it usually remains at 30-100ms. So I guess Optus is just a crappy network.

>So I guess Optus is just a crappy network.

Crappy but *a lot* better than some others out there. I use Optus myself because of it's ideal plan, not for its speed or reliability. Maybe I'll upgrade it in the future. Maybe.

Also you'd probably be able to set up your own connection to the internet so that when other people use your wifi it won't interrupt your play. One solution is to get a modem just for you, although that wouldn't eliminate purely bandwidth. The best solution is to get your own plan and a separate connection.

Best of luck!

Hey ChicKhadee,

Are you still experiencing this issue?

Can you let us know:
- What Internet provider do you use?
- What type of internet do you have (ADSL, fiber, wireless, etc)?
- What city are you in?


We are currently aware of some players in Flip NZ that are experiencing troubles when playing League of Legends and we are gathering data and working with them to try and resolve the issue.

That being said even if you are not with Flip, we still want you to have the best connection possible when playing so if you could head over to http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/tools/network-logs and run our Network Diagnostic Tool, and send the results and a description of your issues to ocelivereports@riotgames.com. Then myself or one of the other OCE Live Team members can add your data to our analysis and try to find out what is causing this issue for you.

-ToxicHawk
